data_bindings.name: Labels/time
data_bindings.description: A column of names or times

data_bindings.name: Values
data_bindings.description: One or more columns of numbers

data_bindings.name: Charts grid
data_bindings.description: If specified and “Grid of charts” view is on, creates a separate mini chart for each value found in the column.

data_bindings.name: Row filter
data_bindings.description: Use this column to create a user-facing row control; to create a column filter use the “Series filter” option in the settings panel instead.

data_bindings.name: Info for custom popups
data_bindings.description: One or more columns of information to include in custom popups

settings.name: Number of combo lines
settings.description: Sets how many of your specified value columns are treated as lines (or lines on the right axis in line-line mode). Counts from the start, so if you want, say, column B as a line and A as a column, set the order in the column settings to "B,A".

settings.name: Grid mode
settings.description: “Grid of charts” creates a mini chart for each series (or each value in your ”Charts grid” column, if specified)

settings.name: Height mode
settings.description: How the graphic's height is determined; ignored when embedded in a fixed-height context such as a simple iframe embed. "Auto" sets the height based on the chart type, data and width. "Standard" uses the default Flourish responsive sizing. "Aspect ratio" sets the aspect of each plot.

settings.name: Aspect (desktop)
settings.description: Aspect ratio of each plot in desktop mode, where 1 is square, above 1 is wider, and below 1 is taller.

settings.name: Aspect (mobile)
settings.description: Aspect of each plot in mobile mode, where 1 is square, above 1 is wider, and below 1 is taller.

settings.name: Breakpoint
settings.description: The width at which mobile mode ends and desktop begins

settings.name: Number of columns
settings.description: In Auto mode, the number of columns will change with screen size

settings.name: Min chart width
settings.description: Determines how many columns of charts there should be in the grid. Ignored if you specify a fixed number of columns.

settings.name: Max chart width
settings.description: Determines how many columns of charts there should be in the grid. Ignored if you specify a fixed number of columns.

settings.name: On data change
settings.description: If a chart in the grid is removed, that cell can either be animated out (with another cell moving to take its place) or reused for the new data in that cell. Auto decides for you based on the data.

settings.name: Size
settings.description: Relative to the width of the chart

settings.name: Padding
settings.description: Horizontal space between text and background
Ensure the x scale is the same across the grid
settings.name: Same across grid
Last row only
settings.description: Only show the x axis on the last row, where possible. Ignored if the x axis is not positioned at the bottom.
Ensure the y scale is the same across the grid
settings.name: Same across grid
First column only
settings.description: Only show the y axis on the first column of the grid, where possible
Ensure the secondary y scale is the same across the grid
settings.name: Same across grid
Last column only
settings.description: Only show the secondary y axis on the last column of the grid, where possible

settings.name: Series filter
settings.description: Filter control for series/columns. Use the animation settings panel to determine whether series animate when changing the filter. Except in single select mode, the user can also filter by clicking on the legend, unless that setting has been disabled.

settings.name: Max series to show
settings.description: Limits the number of series/columns that will be visualized at once

settings.name: Control type
settings.description: Choose between a dropdown, buttons or a time slider.

settings.name: Time between steps
settings.description: Measured in seconds, positive values move the slider left to right, negative values move the slider right to left.

settings.name: Pause before loop
settings.description: Measured in seconds and in addition to the regular step time displayed above.

settings.name: Date/time format in data
settings.description: The date/time format in your data sheet. Used only to sort the data, if required. If your format isn’t in the list, you can enter a custom format using d3-time-format syntax. See npmjs.com/package/d3-time-format for details.

settings.name: Control type
settings.description: Choose between a dropdown, buttons or a time slider.

settings.name: Time between steps
settings.description: Measured in seconds, positive values move the slider left to right, negative values move the slider right to left.

settings.name: Pause before loop
settings.description: Measured in seconds and in addition to the regular step time displayed above.

settings.name: Date/time format in data
settings.description: The date/time format in your data sheet. Used only to sort the data, if required. If your format isn’t in the list, you can enter a custom format using d3-time-format syntax. See npmjs.com/package/d3-time-format for details.

settings.name: Show log control for Y axis
Control type
settings.description: Choose between a dropdown, buttons or a time slider.

settings.name: Time between steps
settings.description: Measured in seconds, positive values move the slider left to right, negative values move the slider right to left.

settings.name: Pause before loop
settings.description: Measured in seconds and in addition to the regular step time displayed above.

settings.name: Date/time format in data
settings.description: The date/time format in your data sheet. Used only to sort the data, if required. If your format isn’t in the list, you can enter a custom format using d3-time-format syntax. See npmjs.com/package/d3-time-format for details.

settings.name: Height
settings.description: Space below and above controls text

settings.name: Border style
settings.description: Show border on all sides, or only at the bottom

settings.name: Extend
settings.description: Automatically generate additional colours when needed to avoid the palette colours being used more than once.

settings.name: Custom overrides
settings.description:
Type the name of the entity whose colour you want to set, a colon and then a colour (using a name, hex-code or rgb declaration). Multiple colours can be set using multiple lines. For example:
Party 1: red
Party 2: #4455AA
Party 3: rgb(30,168,26)
In linear mode, the color scale will run as a smooth gradient between 2 colors. In binned mode, the gradient will be divided in smaller blocks.

settings.name: Custom thresholds
settings.description: Write your custom thresholds, separated by a ";" For example 5;10;15

settings.name: Width
settings.description: In rems, a multiple of the page's base font size

settings.name: Dashed lines
settings.description:
Specify the series that you would like to display with a dashed line. Multiple dashed lines can be set using multiple lines. For example:
Party 1
Party 2
Party 3

settings.name: Which lines to shade between
settings.description:
Specify each area as a pair of line name separated by :: . For example:

Series A :: Series B
Series C :: Series D

You can optionally add a specific color and opacity for each area, e.g.

Series A :: Series B :: red :: 0.1
“Auto” will automatically show dots on lines if fewer than 250 data points; avoid showing dots for large datasets since it can lead to poor performance issues and poor-looking charts

settings.name: Radius
settings.description: In rems, a multiple of the page's base font size

settings.name: Final dot scale (%)
settings.description: Making the last point on a line larger can help emphasise the final value.

settings.name: Bar height
settings.description: Approximate height of bar. Exact height depends on padding and label style. Ignored if chart is embedded at a fixed height. Specifed in rems, a multiple of the base font size.

settings.name: Spacing (main)
settings.description: Space between bar stacks or groups, as a % of the width of a whole bar stack or group

settings.name: Spacing (in group)
settings.description: Space between bars in groups, as a % of the width of a single bar in the group. Ignored if only a single series is selected.

settings.name: Spacing (in stack)
settings.description: Space each bar in the stack, in tenths of a rem (base font size)

settings.name: Scale pies based on data
settings.description: Scale each pie chart in the grid so that the area of each segment reflect its value

settings.name: Size
settings.description: The font size of the labels will be limited to the space available when not in "Auto" height mode

settings.name: Max label width
settings.description: The maximum allowed label width

settings.name: Distance
settings.description: The horizontal space between the data point and the label

settings.name: Spread out overlaps
settings.description: Whether to spread out labels to minimise overlapping

settings.name: Vertical padding
settings.description: The vertical space left between labels when spreading them out to avoid overlaps

settings.name: Hide overlaps
settings.description: Whether to hide any labels that are overlapping in their final position

settings.name: Color
settings.description: If cleared, uses the main text color from the Layout settings panel

settings.name: Outline
settings.description: If cleared, uses the main background color from the Layout settings panel

settings.name: Outline width
settings.description: As a % of the font size

settings.name: Max lines
settings.description: The max number of lines for each label

settings.name: Weight
settings.description: The vertical space left between labels when positioning them

settings.name: Color
settings.description: If cleared, uses the main text color from the Layout settings panel

settings.name: Width
settings.description: In rems (a multiple of base font size)

settings.name: Length
settings.description: The width of the space given over to lines; in rems, a multiple of base font size

settings.name: Padding
settings.description: The padding to the left and right of the line; in rems, a multiple of base font size

settings.name: Position labels on center of dot
Bar label alignment
settings.description: The final option "above" option puts the labels above the bars in standard column charts but falls back to top alignment in stacked charts, where the space above the stack is reserved for stack total labels

settings.name: Padding
settings.description: Space above or below, as a proportion of the font size.

settings.name: Label alignment
settings.description: In stacked bar charts the final "outside bar" option falls back to right alignment, since the space after the stack is reserved for stack total labels (see below)

settings.name: Hide if too big
settings.description: Turn off to force labels to show, even if they will overflow the bars. Ignored when labels are not inside the bars.

settings.name: Text color
settings.description: Contrast mode is black or white depending on the color of the data point (or the color of the background in the case of column chart label positioned over the background)

settings.name: Outline
settings.description: A text outline/background can make the text more readable by increasing contrast.

settings.name: Size
settings.description: Size of the background, as % of text size

settings.name: Show labels for stack totals
settings.description: You may need to update your axis mins/maxes to create space for these labels
Vertical position of the x axis on the y scale
settings.name: Y value
Round min/max
settings.description: When enabled, scales automatically extend to "nice" rounded start/end values, such as hundreds or whole years. Overridden by any explicitly specified scale min and max.

settings.name: Include zero
settings.description: Whether to extend the axis to include zero if the data values are all positive or all negative. Overridden by any explicitly specified scale min and max.

settings.name: Number
settings.description: Approximate number of ticks or gridlines. The actual number will depend on the range of values, chart size, etc.

settings.name: One tick label per line
settings.description: Specify the ticks to show, one per line

settings.name: Edge padding (%)
settings.description: Space between start/end of axis line and first/last category tick as a percentage of the spacing between ticks

settings.name: Put lines between categories
settings.description: On a categorical axis this option disables the gridline on each tick and instead adds rules between each category to give a table-like design. Ignored for date and numeric axes.

settings.name: Extend
settings.description: Extends the dividers into the axis margins.

settings.name: Round min/max
settings.description: When enabled, scales automatically extend to "nice" rounded start/end values, such as hundreds or whole years. Ignored for cagorical scales, and overridden by any specified min/max.

settings.name: Include zero
settings.description: Whether to extend the axis to include zero if the data values are all positive or all negative. Ignored for date and categorical scales, and overridden by any specified min/max.

settings.name: Number
settings.description: Approximate number of ticks or gridlines. The actual number will depend on the range of values, chart size, etc.

settings.name: One tick label per line
settings.description: Specify the ticks to show, one per line

settings.name: Edge padding (%)
settings.description: Space between start/end of axis line and first/last category tick as a percentage of the spacing between ticks

settings.name: Put lines between categories
settings.description: On a categorical axis this option disables the gridline on each tick and instead adds rules between each category to give a table-like design. Ignored for date and numeric axes.

settings.name: Extend
settings.description: Extends the dividers into the axis margins

settings.name: Round min/max
settings.description: When enabled, scales automatically extend to "nice" rounded start/end values, such as hundreds or whole years. Ignored for cagorical scales, and overridden by any specified min/max.

settings.name: Include zero
settings.description: Whether to extend the axis to include zero if the data values are all positive or all negative. Ignored for date and categorical scales, and overridden by any specified min/max.

settings.name: Number
settings.description: Approximate number of ticks or gridlines. The actual number will depend on the range of values, chart size, etc.

settings.name: One tick label per line
settings.description: Specify the ticks to show, one per line

settings.name: Edge padding (%)
settings.description: Space between start/end of axis line and first/last category tick as a percentage of the spacing between ticks

settings.name: Put lines between categories
settings.description: On a categorical axis this option disables the gridline on each tick and instead adds rules between each category to give a table-like design. Ignored for date and numeric axes.

settings.name: Extend
settings.description: Extends the dividers into the axis margins

settings.name: Format in data sheet
settings.description: The date/time format in the data sheet. Leave as “Auto” for Flourish to make a best guess. If it isn’t in the list, you can enter a custom format using d3-time-format syntax. See npmjs.com/package/d3-time-format for details.

settings.name: Display format
settings.description: The date/time format to show in the graphic. If it isn’t in the list, you can enter a custom format using d3-time-format syntax. See npmjs.com/package/d3-time-format for details.

settings.name: Decimal separator in data sheet
settings.description: Used for interpreting your data. Only change if data is not displaying on the chart as expected.

settings.name: Number format to display
settings.description: How the numbers should appear on chart labels

settings.name: Prefix
settings.description: Text to place in front of number

settings.name: Suffix
settings.description: Text to place after number

settings.name: Decimal places
settings.description: Use negative integers to round to positive powers of ten (eg -2 rounds to the nearest 100)

settings.name: Hide thousands separator below 10,000
settings.description: Turn off if you want four-digit numbers to include a separator, e.g. “1,234” rather than “1234”.

settings.name: Show % values
settings.description: Sets whether the raw numbers from the data sheet or the computed percent values from the chart show in labels and popups

settings.name: Prefix
settings.description: Text to place in front of number

settings.name: Suffix
settings.description: Text to place after number

settings.name: Decimal places
settings.description: Use negative integers to round to positive powers of ten (eg -2 rounds to the nearest 100)

settings.name: Hide thousands separator below 10,000
settings.description: Turn off if you want four-digit numbers to include a separator, e.g. “1,234” rather than “1234”.

settings.name: Legend mode
settings.description: “Auto” mode hides the legend in certain situations, such as when each color is already explained by the chart titles in a grid of charts

settings.name: Click legend to filter data
settings.description: Ignored in certain situations, such as when shading by series and using a series control

settings.name: Roundness
settings.description: The radius of the corners of the swatch (in pixels)

settings.name: Custom order override
settings.description: Manually specify the order of legend entries (one entry per line)

settings.name: Height
settings.description: Height of icon (relative to the base font size)

settings.name: Color
settings.description: Fallback color (icon color if not determined by template)

settings.new_section: Add data colors to header text

settings.name: Bold
settings.description: If checked, always use bold for colored items

settings.name: Popup content
settings.description: The text to appear in the popup. Use {{VALUE}} to include the numerical value of the current data point, or {{SERIES}} to display its series name. For any other selected columns use {{column_name}}. Advanced users can include HTML to apply layouts, formatting, images, etc.

settings.name: Radius
settings.description: Corner radius of popup

settings.name: Set series info in popups
settings.description: Allows you to add information about each series/column (e.g. each line) to the popups. Note: This is incompatible with custom popup content.

settings.name: Popup content for series
settings.description:
Adds content to the popup about the series. Separate column name and text with a double colon. For example:
Series 1 :: Comment about Series 1
Series 2 :: Comment about series 2

settings.name: Show highlights on the x axis
One per line, in format “My label :: 2012”
settings.description: You can optionally also specify a color using the format “My label :: 2012 :: #44CCCC”. For visualizations containing a grid of mini charts, you can also apply the annotation on only a specific chart using the format, e.g. “My label :: 2012 :: #44CCCC :: Chart name”.

settings.name: One per line, in format “My label :: 2013 >> 2015”
settings.description: You can optionally also specify a color using the format “My label :: 2013 >> 2015 :: #44CCCC”. For visualizations containing a grid of mini charts, you can also apply the annotation on only a specific chart using the format, e.g. “My label :: 2013 >> 2015 :: #44CCCC :: Chart name”.
Vertically position the label at the top, bottom or in the middle of the line. This setting will be ignored if there is not enough space for the selected position
settings.name: Y position

settings.description: Horizontally position the label on the left, the right or in the middle of the line. This setting will be ignored if there is not enough space for the selected position
settings.name: X position
Show highlights on the y axis
One per line, in format “My label :: 5000”
settings.description: You can optionally also specify a color using the format “My label :: 5000 :: #44CCCC”. For visualizations containing a grid of mini charts, you can also apply the annotation on only a specific chart using the format, e.g. “My label :: 5000 :: #44CCCC :: Chart name”.

settings.name: One per line, in format “My label :: 2000 >> 8000”
settings.description: You can optionally also specify a color using the format “My label :: 2000 >> 8000 :: #44CCCC”. For visualizations containing a grid of mini charts, you can also apply the annotation on only a specific chart using the format, e.g. “My label :: 2000 >> 8000” :: #44CCCC :: Chart name”.
Horizontally position label on the left, the middle or the right end of the line. This setting will be ignored if there is not enough space for the selected position
settings.name: X position

settings.description: Vertically position the label above, below or in the middle of the line. This setting will be ignored if there is not enough space for the selected position
settings.name: Y position
Show styling options
settings.new_section: Free annotations (visible in Story mode only)

settings.name: Animation duration
settings.description: The duration, in milliseconds, of transitions – for example between two slides in a story

settings.name: Only animate series with same name
settings.description: Determines how animations work when the data changes (e.g. between slides in a story). When this is on, series (e.g. lines) will attempt to animate to become another line  only if they have the same name (i.e. the same column header).

settings.name: Only animate points with same label
settings.description: Determines how animations work when the data changes (e.g. between slides in a story). When this is on, data points (e.g. dots or bars) will attempt to animate to become other data points if they have the same label (e.g. date or category).

settings.name: Main font
settings.description: This font will apply to the whole graphic by default, but you can optionally change the font for the title, subtitle, footer, etc in the Header and Footer settings panels.

settings.name: Text color
settings.description: This color will apply to the whole graphic by default, but you can optionally change the color for individual text elements, in other settings panels.

settings.name: Maximum width
settings.description: Apply a maximum width to just the main graphic or everything (main graphic plus header, footer, etc)

settings.name: Maximum width
settings.description: Leave blank to stretch to container width

settings.name: Custom
settings.description: Specify a custom responsive font size. Best results will be with values between 1.2 and 3

settings.name: Custom
settings.description: Specify a custom responsive font size. Best results will be with values between 1.2 and 3

settings.name: Custom
settings.description: Specify a custom responsive font size. Best results will be with values between 1.2 and 3

settings.name: Space
settings.description: Space between border and header text

settings.name: Align
settings.description: Align logo inside header or outer visualisation container
The secondary note is placed below the source and primary note
settings.name: Note (secondary)

defaults.datastudio: Visit flourish.studio to create branded, embeddable, mobile-friendly visualizations

settings.name: Image (light version)
settings.description: If provided this version will be used whenever the background colour is dark

settings.name: Space
settings.description: Space between border and footer text

settings.name: Screenreader mode for main visual container
settings.description: Whether the main visual container is visible to screenreaders. (Text in the header and footer are always available to screenreaders.)

settings.name: Screenreader description
settings.description: A text alternative to the visual content that will only be visible to screenreaders, e.g. “The line chart shows China consistently higher than the other countries since 1990”. Do no replicate your title, since that will also be read by screenreaders.

settings.name: Update project from URL
settings.description: Make it possible to change the visualization's settings/state from the URL hash, for example when embedding in an iframe or popup panel

settings.name: Allowed state properties
settings.description: List each state property you want to make changeable with the URL hash. See the template page for a full list of state properties. Add one property name per line. Use dot format for nested properties, e.g. `layout.background_color`
